title: Guys, it's the first day of the pbe on the first patch of the preseason.
body: Settle the fuck down. If problems are still there as the beginning of Season 6 looms around the corner, then go ahead and write your threads about how horrible Riot's balancing is. But for now, chill the fuck out.

replies.body: Isnt this a feedback board? I thought people were supposed to "discuss" those "problems" here?
Except all the problems aren't even on the public servers.  So far people are complaining about what's on paper.

>
> Except all the problems aren't even on the public servers.  So far people are complaining about what's on paper.

Well the whole point of the PBE is for feedback. Complaining about stuff before it's on the live server is what stops stuff getting on the live server. As long as people are saying "I don't like this" rather than acting as if the game has already been destroyed by something that hasn't happened yet, I think it's fine.
Yeah...that's why there's a PBE board for people actually playing on the PBE
As long as it's not extreme, then fine.

> [{quoted}](name=DarkSoul245,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=usNwcQgh,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-10-30T03:20:31.893+0000)
>
> See, but most of the feedback is terrible, probably pressuring Riot into Nerfing/Buffing, certain things. *COUGH* Juggernauts *COUGH*. They haven't even tested the changes and are already complaining. TEST FIRST, before making dumb statements.

Out of all 4 Juggernauts, only Garen and Skarner came out OP as a result of player feedback. Darius was UP on re.release, and Morde had nothing to do with community. After first change, Garen and Scarner were toned down, Darius became OP due to buffs community complained about before they hit live, Morde stayed the same because he was perma banned and they didn't have the data to make the adjustments. What did people complain the most? level gaining as solo laner in dual lane, which is the same thing being nerfed on his kit.

Community is not the best at guessing the effect of the changes, but unfortunately Riot isn't as well,even though they have a lot of thata and that internal testing we know nothing about. 

In fact, over the years I have seen Riot implementing new things to the game which I had seen loong before in board treads by community. Some of the ideas currently implemented in the game, like ward limits to end vision wars, were suggested long before by the community and, at the time, shut down by Riot as unviable.

"It's only the PBE, it's not final!"

Oh, I've heard this so many times...

Obviously the general concept is going to stay but the numbers have plenty of room for fine tuning, especially since it's the pre-season. The Season 5 preseason saw massive adjustments before the season actually started.

thats the thing, numbers get changed but the concept stays.
Now if the concept is the issue, we have a problem, and this preseason has quite some conceptual issues to me, mostly with the itemchanges, and not numberchanges would change that...(*RNG*)

So if we want a change(or more a un-change in this case), we have to speak up early to have atleast a small chance on influenceing anything.
We saw quite a few things unceremoniously removed in their entirety last time around, if I'm not mistaken.

there are a bunch of changes that are outright stupid and push an already strong class of champions way too far. like why the fuck is every ad item in the game change to adc specific.

imagine garens early game would have been buffed with the juggernaut patch instead of all around nerfed, while he was mandatory every game. thats the dimension of buffs thats happening here.

marksmen are already strong. theyre buffing them early and late.

If you want to question some of their choices, then please, go for it. That's what preseason before. But the key word here is "question" and questioning implies being open to receiving an answer and a willingness to change one's mind is that answer is reasonable. But lots of people aren't here to really talk about the changes; they're here to "discuss" them. And by discuss, I mean circlejerk about how retarded Riot is. I for one question removing so many stats from Triforce and I also question nerfing so many of the non-adc items, but I'm not going to pretend that all the numbers on the PBE are what is going to hit 6.1. I'm willing to give Riot the benefit of the doubt for now. Key word being, for now. If Graves jungle is rocking a 57% win rate right before the season starts, I'm gonna have something to say. We'll need a few weeks on live servers to see just how all this stuff pans out. Until then, I'm withholding judgement.
PBE is up now, this is the best possible time to give feedback so changes can go through before the patch gets shipped out.

way wrong attitude.
IF we don't complain about what feels wrong for us now, it will certainly not be adressed.
History already shows that Riot is very, **very** hesitant on reverting changes once they hit pbe if it's beyond some number-tweaking.
IF we want to have a chance for our worries to be heard **and** haveing riot react to them, we have to speak up now.
If we wait till preseason is over, nothing will get changed for sure.

On the other hand, Riot has been doing this for, what i would say is, a pretty long time, for a game that is, and I would expect them to be able to anticipate issues much more efficiently. They shouldn't keep having the "oh crap, what did we do" moments ever preseason.
